author: Howard Forman
title: One Way Hospitals (and Patients) Can Improve Emergency Care
text: Howard Forman (@thehowie) is a professor of radiology, economics, public health and management at Yale University. Imagine yourself at your most vulnerable, arriving at your local emergency department (ED) with an uncertain fate awaiting you. Without warning or preparation, you hand over control to a group of compassionate, smart, but previously unknown individuals in order Don’t Call Yourself a Consultant on a Résumé When You’re Really a Freelancer Next For Children in the Hospital, VR May Be the Cure for Anxiety
